snippet: At a time when government austerity policies have led to cuts, Europe’s debate over immigration has become intertwined with a thorny discussion of the costs of welfare.
abstract: Great Britain has been flooded with immigrants from Poland since eight former Communist countries were admitted to European Union in 2004, prompting some to question rules that allow them to claim welfare benefits; rules that allow people to move freely throughout the European Union and give them equal rights are being questioned for first time in years.
lead_paragraph: At a time when government austerity policies have led to cuts, Europe’s debate over immigration has become intertwined with a thorny discussion of the costs of welfare.

headline.main: A Harder Look at Welfare Rules as Europeans Flood Countries in Search of Jobs
headline.print_headline: Volatile European Mix: Welfare and Migration
